meanings.definition: Work done in addition to one's regular job.
meanings.sent1: She took on extra outwork to earn more money.
meanings.sent2: His outwork as a tutor helped him save for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: The outwork of babysitting on weekends kept her busy.
meanings.sent4: The outwork of volunteering at the shelter filled her with joy.
meanings.sent5: The outwork of gardening in the evenings was relaxing.

meanings.definition: A defensive structure outside a main fortification.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers defended the fort from the outwork.
meanings.sent2: The outwork provided an extra layer of protection.
meanings.sent3: The outwork looked like a mini fortress on its own.
meanings.sent4: The outwork stood strong against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The outwork was strategically positioned to guard the entrance.

meanings.definition: To surpass in work or achievement.
meanings.sent1: She always strives to outwork her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outwork his personal best time.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outwork the fastest runner was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outwork obstacles was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: He aimed to outwork all expectations and succeed.
